title: Days of the past;
author: Shand, Alexander Innes
snippet: They may say what they like of the Scot looking closely to sixpences : when great principles are at stake, he will scatter bank-notes broadcast, and stint himself to keep up his subscriptions year after year. Four hundred and seventy ministers resigned their benefices, following Chalmers from St. Andrew's Church to the Canonmills, trusting their future and that of their families to the liberality of their lay supporters ; nor was their confidence misplaced. I can faintly remember that memorable procession : the black-coated ministers leading the way, followed by an excited train of elders and laymen through the silent and sympathetic crowds.
